profile_positions.description:
Coordinating all regulatory compliance matters on the Haewene Brim Campaign 2021 consisting of various upgrades, life time extension, maintenance, full class and statutory renewal surveys and UK verification. 
Main activities:
- As part of PMT, preparing project plans, maintaining permit, license etc. databases, provide training/support to client, engineers, subcontractors/suppliers/vendors etc.
- Coordinating all permits, licenses, approvals, notifications and consents for all key stages of the project.
- Focal point for coastal state authorities, flag state, class society, ICP, pilots, port authorities etc related to HBC2021 activities.
- Coordinating tow surveys, STCW manning certification for disconnect and relocation of the FPSO including all FPSO certification and exemptions.
- Coordinate certification and verification or procured materials and components (CMC/VMC).
- Coordinate FEED, basic and detailed design reviews performed by DNV including notified/approved body reviews and related inspections.
- Support project team and yard in (un)mooring, docking, freefall lifeboat launching/seatrials and other marine activities.
- Coordinating RC and DNV presence on yard to cover all HBC2021 scopes and complete required (re)certification surveys/inspections/examinations/audits.

profile_positions.description:
Currently I am working in the HSEQ & RC Department.
The primary task is to ensure that the FPSO's of the company are in compliance with all applicable rules, regulations and legislation as prescribed by Class Societies, International Maritime Organization, the Flag State, Coastal Governments and other relevant bodies. For this, there is regular contact with aformentioned bodies. The FPSO's itself are visited to make sure the legislation is implemented in a correct manner.

RC Engineer within project team of DPII FPSO 'Munin' which consisted:
- creating scopes for class renewal surveys, laid up surveys and pre-voyage surveys in cooperation with operations within Bluewater, classification societies and flagstate.
- Establish regulatory compliance plans for the project, 'rules, regulations, codes and standards' lists for project team and maintaining and monitoring the 'PLANC' (Permits Licences Approvals Notifications & Consents) database.
- Focal point within bluewater for maritime and coastal state authorities relevant to the project.




Furthermore the implementation, maintenance and auditing of ISPS and ISM related matters are part of the responsibilities of RC.

profile_positions.company: Bluewater Energy Services (contracted through Middle Point)
profile_positions.description:
Project Manager Clean cold lay-up of DP2 FPSO Munin in Labuan(Malaysia). 
During the project I was responsible for the following:
- Budgets for relocation and clean lay-up of FPSO Munin.
- Timely set-up and follow up contract with DNVGL, LOC(warranty Surveyor), POSH(tugboat owners), Wilhelmsen Asset Care and local contractors in Labuan.
- Flagstate, class and fitness for tow surveys in line with statutory, coastal and Insurance requirements including approval of transport manual.
- Obtaining all required permission, certificates, clearances for relocating FPSO Munin from Indonesia to Malaysia without delays.
- Approval of mooring analysis and clean lay-up plan for long term cold lay-up.
- Safety of all crew and contractors on board.
- Progress and continuity of preservations done by FPSO crew and Lay-up provider and contractors.
- Set-up of agreements and succesful completion of DNVGL Clean Lay-up survey in line with DNVGL guideline for lay-up of ships. Lay-up was performed in the best manner for preserving the FPSO system with the least impact on the environment. Due to good cooperation with and efforts of lay-up provider and machinery suppliers, we achieved air emissions significantly below Tier II limits of MARPOL.
- Coordinating and executing lay-up preservations on FPSO systems for long-term lay-up

Achievements 
- Execution of tow with lowest possible risk profile for Insurance resulting in more than 90% reduction in Insurance premium.
- Obtained the worlds first 'Clean cold lay-up' declaration after preservations were completed by the FPSO Munin crew and lay-up provider.
- Completed planned scope safely within schedule, budget and without any delays.
- As the company representative, succesfully handed over the FPSO Munin to lay-up provider.

profile_positions.description:
Fullfilled the role of Lead Regulatory Compliance Engineer to coordinate regulatory compliance for the FPSO Haewene Brim during the yard phase resulting into all scoped class, flag and verification activities to be completed within the agreed windows.
- Responsible for Regulatory Compliance in various phases of the project from detailed design, construction to commissioning.
- Contribute to the development of project specific Regulatory Compliance Plan and maintaining Permits and Consents Plan.
- Ensure that all new regulatory requirements and revisions to existing requirements are captured and communicated to the project team
- Facilitate and assist discipline leads and individual engineers to comply with relevant regulatory requirements, and by that ensuring the design meets regulatory requirements, such as class, flag and coastal state requirements
- Coordinate and follow up Class and Statutory Contracts, Activities, Comment Response sheet and approval letter
- Liaise with class, flagstate and subcontractor via project management for the submission of documents and close out of comments
- Maintaining records of deviations, clarifications and agreements approved by the Authorities
- Review relevant project documents and deliverables to ensure key regulatory requirements are identified and complied with
- Proactively support and cooperate with all engineering disciplines to achieve compliant design results, including relevant input and comments to other discipline deliveries
- Technical review with regard to regulatory compliance content
- Mentor and resource for new employees and consultants
- Act as regulatory compliance focal point towards Authorities for Bluewater, client and subcontractors.

profile_positions.description:
As a dual purpose officer, called a Maritime Officer, I was responsible for the maintenance,  the checking and administrative work of electrical, mechanical, nautical and safety systems. Maintenance on main propulsion systems and all auxiliary systems was generally done by ourselves. 
Other discipline of the maritime officer was the safe navigation in coastal and international waters, cargo planning/checking and reefer maintenance. Regular onboard and 3rd party company training was given to ensure that level of competence was up or above standard. As a designated training officer I was responsible for the correct implementation of safety training systems to keep safety awareness and skills up-to date.
